org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.layout
Class BorderLayoutData

java.lang.Object
  org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.layout.LayoutData
      org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.layout.BorderLayoutData

public class BorderLayoutData
extends LayoutData

Layout data object for BorderLayout. Each widget controlled by a BorderLayout can have its initial size and region specified by an instance of this layout data object.

Author:
georgopoulos.georgios(at)gmail.com
See Also:
BorderLayout

Constructor Detail

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData()
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData. The associated widget should be undecorated. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified to BorderLayout.Region.CENTER. The widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData(boolean decorate)
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData by specifying that the associated widget should be decorated if parameter decorate is true, and undecorated if false. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified to BorderLayout.Region.CENTER. The widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

Parameters:
decorate - decorate specifies whether the associated widget will be decorated or not.

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData(BorderLayout.Region region)
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData. The associated widget should be undecorated. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified by the region parameter. The BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH child widgets are stretched horizontally, while the height of the widgets is set to the calculated preferred height; the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST child widgets are stretched vertically, while the width of the widgets is set to the calculated preferred width; the BorderLayout.Region.CENTER child widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

Parameters:
region - the region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel with a BorderLayout.

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData(BorderLayout.Region region,
                        boolean decorate)
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData by specifying that the associated widget should be decorated if parameter decorate is true, and undecorated if false. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified by the region parameter. The BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH child widgets are stretched horizontally, while the height of the widgets is set to the calculated preferred height; the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST child widgets are stretched vertically, while the width of the widgets is set to the calculated preferred width; the BorderLayout.Region.CENTER child widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

Parameters:
region - the region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel with a BorderLayout.
decorate - decorate specifies whether the associated widget will be decorated or not.

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData(BorderLayout.Region region,
                        double preferredSize)
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData. The associated widget should be undecorated. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified by the region parameter. The BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH child widgets are stretched horizontally, while the height of the widgets is specified by the preferredSize parameter; the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST child widgets are stretched vertically, while the width of the widgets is specified by the preferredSize parameter; the BorderLayout.Region.CENTER child widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

For preferredSize parameter values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means the calculated preferred size.

Parameters:
region - the region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel with a BorderLayout.
preferredSize - the preferred size or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred size should be used instead of this value.

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData(BorderLayout.Region region,
                        double preferredSize,
                        boolean decorate)
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData by specifying that the associated widget should be decorated if parameter decorate is true, and undecorated if false. The associated widget should be undecorated. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified by the region parameter. The BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH child widgets are stretched horizontally, while the height of the widgets is specified by the preferredSize parameter; the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST child widgets are stretched vertically, while the width of the widgets is specified by the preferredSize parameter; the BorderLayout.Region.CENTER child widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

For preferredSize parameter values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means the calculated preferred size.

Parameters:
region - the region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel with a BorderLayout.
preferredSize - the preferred size or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred size should be used instead of this value.
decorate - decorate specifies whether the associated widget will be decorated or not.

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData(BorderLayout.Region region,
                        double preferredSize,
                        int minSize,
                        int maxSize)
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData. The associated widget should be undecorated. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified by the region parameter. The BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH child widgets are stretched horizontally, while the initial height of the widgets is specified by the preferredSize parameter; the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST child widgets are stretched vertically, while the initial width of the widgets is specified by the preferredSize parameter; the BorderLayout.Region.CENTER child widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

The minSize and maxSize parameters specify that the height, for widgets placed on the BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH regions, or the width, for widgets placed on the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST regions, can be changed by the user by dragging a split bar, to the value in the range [minSize, maxSize].

For all size parameter values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means the calculated preferred size.

Parameters:
region - the region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel with a BorderLayout.
preferredSize - the preferred size or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred size should be used instead of this value.
minSize - the minimum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized to by the user, by dragging a split bar.
maxSize - the maximum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized to by the user, by dragging a split bar.

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData(BorderLayout.Region region,
                        double preferredSize,
                        int minSize,
                        int maxSize,
                        boolean decorate)
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData by specifying that the associated widget should be decorated if parameter decorate is true, and undecorated if false. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified by the region parameter. The BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH child widgets are stretched horizontally, while the initial height of the widgets is specified by the preferredSize parameter; the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST child widgets are stretched vertically, while the initial width of the widgets is specified by the preferredSize parameter; the BorderLayout.Region.CENTER child widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

The minSize and maxSize parameters specify that the height, for widgets placed on the BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH regions, or the width, for widgets placed on the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST regions, can be changed by the user by dragging a split bar, to the value in the range [minSize, maxSize].

For all size parameter values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means the calculated preferred size.

Parameters:
region - the region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel with a BorderLayout.
preferredSize - the preferred size or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred size should be used instead of this value.
minSize - the minimum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized to by the user, by dragging a split bar.
maxSize - the maximum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized to by the user, by dragging a split bar.
decorate - decorate specifies whether the associated widget will be decorated or not.

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData(BorderLayout.Region region,
                        int minSize,
                        int maxSize)
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData. The associated widget should be undecorated. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified by the region parameter. The BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH child widgets are stretched horizontally, while the initial height of the widgets is set to the calculated preferred height; the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST child widgets are stretched vertically, while the initial width of the widgets is set to the calculated preferred width; the BorderLayout.Region.CENTER child widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

The minSize and maxSize parameters specify that the height, for widgets placed on the BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH regions, or the width, for widgets placed on the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST regions, can be changed by the user by dragging a split bar, to the value in the range [minSize, maxSize].

For all size parameter values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means the calculated preferred size.

Parameters:
region - the region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel with a BorderLayout.
minSize - the minimum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized to by the user, by dragging a split bar.
maxSize - the maximum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized to by the user, by dragging a split bar.

BorderLayoutData

public BorderLayoutData(BorderLayout.Region region,
                        int minSize,
                        int maxSize,
                        boolean decorate)
Creates a new instance of BorderLayoutData by specifying that the associated widget should be decorated if parameter decorate is true, and undecorated if false. The region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel is specified by the region parameter. The BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH child widgets are stretched horizontally, while the initial height of the widgets is set to the calculated preferred height; the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST child widgets are stretched vertically, while the initial width of the widgets is set to the calculated preferred width; the BorderLayout.Region.CENTER child widget will be stretched both horizontally and vertically to fill any space left over.

The minSize and maxSize parameters specify that the height, for widgets placed on the BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH regions, or the width, for widgets placed on the BorderLayout.Region.EAST and BorderLayout.Region.WEST regions, can be changed by the user by dragging a split bar, to the value in the range [minSize, maxSize].

For all size parameter values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means the calculated preferred size.

Parameters:
region - the region of the widget added to a LayoutPanel with a BorderLayout.
minSize - the minimum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized to by the user, by dragging a split bar.
maxSize - the maximum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized to by the user, by dragging a split bar.
decorate - decorate specifies whether the associated widget will be decorated or not.
Method Detail

getMaxSize

public int getMaxSize()
Gets the maximum widget size, either height for widgets placed on BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH or width for widgets placed on BorderLayout.Region.WEST and BorderLayout.Region.EAST, that the widget can be resized by dragging a split bar. Values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means the calculated preferred size.

Returns:
the maximum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized by dragging a split bar.

getMinSize

public int getMinSize()
Gets the minimum widget size, either height for widgets placed on BorderLayout.Region.NORTH and BorderLayout.Region.SOUTH or width for widgets placed on BorderLayout.Region.WEST and BorderLayout.Region.EAST, that the widget can be resized by dragging a split bar. Values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means the calculated preferred size.

Returns:
the maximum widget size, either width or height, that the widget can be resized by dragging a split bar.

getPreferredSize

public double getPreferredSize()
Returns the user specified preferred size of a child widget, either width or height in pixels or ratio depending on the LayoutManager. Default is -1 which means that the widget's calculated preferred size should be used instead. Values > 0 and <= 1 are ratios, 0 and values > 1 are pixels.

Returns:
the preferred size or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred size should be used instead of this value.
See Also:
BaseLayout.getFlowWidth(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget), BaseLayout.getFlowHeight(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget)

setPreferredSize

public void setPreferredSize(double preferredSize)
Sets the child widget's preferred size, either width or height in pixels or ratio depending on the LayoutManager. Values > 0 and <= 1 are ratios, 0 and values > 1 are pixels, and -1 means that the widget's calculated preferred size should be used.

Parameters:
preferredSize - the preferred size or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred size should be used instead of this value.
